experiment_groups.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on pyrolysis oil yield
experiment_groups.hypothesis: Increasing the mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock will decrease the pyrolysis oil yield.
evidence_sentences: The highest oil production was found when the mixture PPO111 was used in the pyrolysis and lowest was found when the PPO811 mixture was used.
The liquid PPO yield obtained from PPO11, PPO211, PPO411 and PPO811are 83 wt%, 81 wt%, 80 wt% and 78 wt% respectively.
From Fig. 3(a) it can be concluded that the oil yield slightly decreases with the increase of HPDE.

experiment_groups.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on distillation product distribution
experiment_groups.hypothesis: Increasing the mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock will increase the petrol fraction and decrease the residue fraction in pyrolysis oil.
evidence_sentences: The figure also reveals that oil from the mixture PPO111 has lowest petrol component (39 wt%) than that of other mixtures (46.5 wt% for PPO211 and 46 wt% for both PPO411 and PPO811 mixtures).
However, PPO111 mixture has the highest amount of residue (8 wt%) among all the other mixtures.

The results show that when the HDPE mass increases, the percentage of diesel in pyrolysis oil changes marginally but petrol increases significantly with the increase of HDPE whereas residue decreases.

experiment_groups.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on crude oil and diesel properties
experiment_groups.hypothesis: Increasing the mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock will decrease the kinematic viscosity and density of crude pyrolysis oil and distilled diesel, and increase the cetane index.
evidence_sentences: From the figure it can be concluded that, with increase in HDPE amount in the plastic mixture KV decreases slightly for all four samples of crude and distilled diesel cut samples tested.
The density decreases with increase of HDPE in the plastic mixture for both crude PPO and DC linearly.
The figure shows that the cetane index increases significantly with the increase of HDPE amount in the plastic feedstock mixture.

experiment_groups.group_name: Effect of HDPE mass ratio on aromatic hydrocarbon content
experiment_groups.hypothesis: Increasing the mass ratio of HDPE in mixed plastic feedstock will reduce the total aromatic hydrocarbon (AH) and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) content in both crude pyrolysis oil and distilled diesel.
evidence_sentences: It was noticed that as the percentage of HDPE increases in the plastic feedstock sample the amount of AH and PAH decreases for both crude PPO and distilled diesel cut.
The lowest amount of AH was documented for PPO811 sample which was 24 wt% and 18.81 wt% for crude PPO and distilled diesel fraction respectively.
Whereas, for PPO111 sample the amount of AH was highest (42.8 wt% and 35.1 wt% for crude PPO and distilled diesel fraction respectively) among all the samples tested.
From Fig. 7(b), it can be seen that for all the samples the amount of PAH increases after distillation in the diesel fraction.
